scenarioDescription:
The HD 197037 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 197037 is a star with 1.11 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 108.27 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 1.9 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 197037 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 197037 system


HD 197037 b

HD 197037 b was discovered by the McDonald Observatory observatory, in 2012-04, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 197037 b is 251.220 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 197037 b is 13.900 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 197037 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 197037, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the McDonald Observatory.
name: HD 197037 - System With 1 Exoplanet
